pullRequest.title: Add Support for Environment Proxy Configurations
pullRequest.bodyText:
Updated the Netty and OkHttp HttpClients to check the environment for proxy configuration if the ProxyOptions set in their builder is null. Additionally, added the ability to set the Configuration object that the builders will use when retrieving proxy information from the environment.
Environment proxy configurations will be loaded in the following order:

Azure HTTPS
Azure HTTP
Java HTTPS
Java HTTP

Azure proxy configurations are preferred over the Java proxy configurations as they relate more closely to the SDKs, additionally HTTPS is preferred over HTTP as it is more secure. Java proxies will require java.net.useSystemProxies to be true before that proxy configuration is applied.

nodes.bodyText: Add a log when there's a malformed url. It helps in debugging issues.
Consider making these named constants DEFAULT_HTTPS_PORT and DEFAULT_HTTP_PORT.

Think of this error message from the users perspective - this will probably require them to do a search for this string and hope they have found a valid result. What additional guidance can you provide in here to help the user solve this without a web search being required?
You might want to consider moving the ternary operation inside the method call and doing it on one line?
Same comment as earlier for here
Is 'non-proxy hosts' common terminology? How does the user work with multiple non-proxy hosts? If it is, e.g. comma-separated, would it be better for the API to be varargs or a List?
I wonder if we should call this fromConfiguration, that feels a little more Java idiomatic
